member.name: T:Clide.Diagnostics.TracerManager.DiagnosticsTracer.SourceNameReplacer
member.summary: The TraceSource instance name matches the name of each of the "segments" we built the aggregate source from. This means that when we trace, we issue multiple trace statements, one for each. If a listener is added to (say) "*" source name, all traces done through it will appear as coming from the source "*", rather than (say) "Foo.Bar" which might be the actual source class. This diminishes the usefulness of hierarchical loggers significantly, since it now means that you need to add listeners too all trace sources you're interested in receiving messages from, and all its "children" potentially, some of them which might not have been created even yet. This is not feasible. Instead, since we issue the trace call to each trace source (which is what enables the configurability of all those sources in the app.config file), we need to fix the source name right before tracing, so that a configured listener at "*" still receives as the source name the original (aggregate) one, and not "*". This requires some private reflection, and a lock to guarantee proper logging, but this decreases its performance. However, since we log asynchronously, it's fine.

member.name: T:Clide.IFluentInterface
member.summary: Interface that is used to build fluent interfaces and hides methods declared by from IntelliSense.
member.remarks:
Code that consumes implementations of this interface should expect one of two things:
When referencing the interface from within the same solution (project reference), you will still see the methods this interface is meant to hide.
When referencing the interface through the compiled output assembly (external reference), the standard Object methods will be hidden as intended.
See http://bit.ly/ifluentinterface for more information.

member.name: T:Clide.Patterns.Adapter.IFluentInterface
member.summary: Interface that is used to build fluent interfaces and hides methods declared by from IntelliSense.
member.remarks:
Code that consumes implementations of this interface should expect one of two things:
When referencing the interface from within the same solution (project reference), you will still see the methods this interface is meant to hide.
When referencing the interface through the compiled output assembly (external reference), the standard Object methods will be hidden as intended.
See http://bit.ly/ifluentinterface for more information.

member.summary: Gets the developer environment for the given service provider. Make sure you pass your package to get your scoped dev env.
member.remarks: By default, the instance is cached for the given service provider, and only created once, using the given IDE services as necessary. This default behavior can be overriden by setting the .
member.param: Typically, this is your package service provider, so that all provided ClideComponents are properly resolved and available through it. If you pass in the global VS service provider, you will get an instance that only contains the core Clide services but does not export any of the package Clide components.

If you pass in the global VS service provider, you will get an instance that only contains the core Clide services but does not export any of the package Clide components.

Startup code in the application should invoke the method before any adaptations are performed. Alternatively, a transient service API is provided that allows specific contexts to override the global implementation, typically in multi-threaded test runs, which invoke the method instead.
This transient instance remains the current adapter service for the duration of the call, including spanned threads or tasks.

member.name: T:Clide.IReferenceProvider
member.summary: Provides the basic non-generic protocol for the reference provider. Implementations should inherit from .
member.remarks: A reference provider is responsible for converting from object instances to references like file://foo.txt. The determines which provider will be invoked to resolve which references, as well as the type to be resolved.

member.name: P:Clide.IReferenceProvider.Scheme
member.summary: Gets the scheme of the provider. All created references from this provider must use this scheme followed by a colon.
member.remarks: The scheme is case-sensitive when locating the provider for a given reference.

member.summary: Provides a registration mechanism for reference providers that are used by the .

member.summary: Registers the specified provider with the service.
member.param: The reference provider to register.
member.exception: A provider has already been registered for the same scheme.

member.name: M:Clide.IReferenceProviderRegistry.IsRegistered(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the reference scheme is registered as a valid provider.
member.param: The reference scheme to be checked, such as "vsix" or "project", with or without the trailing ":" or "://".
member.returns: , if a reference provider exists for the scheme; otherwise

member.name: T:Clide.IReferenceProvider`1
member.summary: Allows to create and resolve references for the target type T.
member.typeparam: The type of instance to be resolved or referenced
member.remarks:
The , if it succeeds, must always return references that start with the followed by a colon, like vsix://my-vsix-identifier or project:my-project-guid
The references are intentionally strings and not because the type imposes more strict rules than are required for a general-purpose private referencing service.

member.name: M:Clide.IReferenceProvider`1.TryCreateReference(`0)
member.summary: Tries to create a reference for the instance of T.
member.param: The instance to create a reference for.
member.returns: The reference to the instance or if a reference cannot be created for the given instance.

member.name: M:Clide.IReferenceProvider`1.TryOpen(`0)
member.summary: Tries to open the instance in the appropiate view.
member.param: The instance to open in its default view.
member.returns: if the instance could be opened; otherwise.

member.name: M:Clide.IReferenceProvider`1.TryResolveReference(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to resolve the given reference to an instance of T.
member.param: The reference to try to resolve.
member.returns: The resolved reference or if it could not be resolved to a valid instance of .

member.name: T:Clide.IReferenceService
member.summary: Provides a general mechanism to create reference handles to objects and to resolve them to their referenced instance later.
member.remarks:
This service manages references by allowing creation, resolution and opening of those references. Reference providers implementing are registered with the , which is used by this service to determine which providers to invoke according to the received instance types or the optional scheme passed to the relevant methods.
The references are intentionally strings and not because the type imposes more strict rules than are required for a general-purpose private referencing service, since it adheres to the internet standard, which is beyond the requirements for this general-purpose private referencing system.
This service will attempt to find the most appropriate provider according to the instance types.
The service also ensures that providers return valid references according to their specified .

member.name: M:Clide.IReferenceService.TryCreateReference``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Tries to create a reference for the instance of T.
member.typeparam: The type of the instance to create a reference for.
member.param: The instance to create a reference for.
The optional scheme to use to determine how the reference should be created. If none is specified, a registered of the given would create the reference.
member.returns: The reference to the instance or if no registered provider could create the reference.

member.summary: Tries to open the instance in the appropiate view.

member.param: The instance to open in its default view.

member.returns: if the instance could be opened; otherwise.

member.name: M:Clide.TracingExtensions.Error(Clide.Diagnostics.ITracer,System.Exception,System.String,System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Traces an event of type with the given exception and message and adds an error to the error list that will be handled by the provided function.
member.param: The tracer that will perform the error logging.
The exception that will be logged.
The message to log.
A callback function to call when the user selects the error in the error list. The return value determines if the error has been fixed and can be deleted from the error list () or not.
member.remarks: This overload adds an error to the error list, and allows a callback to run when the user double-clicks the error in the error list. The function return value determines if the error will be cleared from the list after the handler finishes running or not.
